medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 2 days prior to admission after choking on chicken during dinner. The patient became fearful of swallowing, unable to eat despite cutting food into small pieces. He vomited after eating ice cream the next day and reduced fluid intake to 710 ml of water. He exhibited ongoing anxiety and needed his mother's presence due to an irrational fear of choking. Nine days before admission, episodes of inspiratory stridor during sleep were reported, prompting a referral to an otolaryngologist.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Past medical history includes gastro-esophageal reflux and a milk-protein allergy in infancy. He had also received sensory-integration skills training during childhood. The patient has keratosis pilaris and eczema.
medical_history.family_history: Younger brother has moderate autism spectrum disorder and diagnoses of PANDAS and vitamin D deficiency. Maternal grandfather had heart disease and diabetes, grandmother had psoriasis and died from breast cancer, and paternal grandmother had hypertension and congestive heart failure.
medical_history.social_history: The patient lives with family, is a student receiving writing support, and recently moved from Southern California to the northeast United States.
